answers.answer: Your blood pressure isn't very high they don't really worry about it until it's 150/90, I'd guess you don't have it but can't be sure, swelling is normal at the end of pregnancy

I'm 31+3 weeks FTM and I'm developing preeclampsia and your bottom number is the one they watch the most. mine is over mid 130/90+ I also have protein in my urine. Each visit when you give urine they check it for protein so if your doctor hasn't mentioned finding any or had you do a 24 hour urine test i would say your ok. Swelling is very common in pregnancy. they look for swelling in the face and neck or the swelling that pits when you press into it. I also have GD which can cause higher BP and also retaining water can cause the extra swelling. My doctor is trying to get me to 37 weeks before we deliver because of the GD and early stages of preeclampsia. Your doctor is there for questions whenever you need peace of mind as well :) congrats and good luck!!

question: My feet ankles and legs are swollen. My bp is usually 120/70 but tonight its 133/75.  Do you think this is the beginning stages? I'm 39 weeks with gd which puts me at higher risk. I go to the doc tomorrow.
title: hum preclamsia?
